titles.title: Foods Are Not Drugs Act of 1987
A bill to amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to define the authority of the Secretary of Health and Human Services with respect to regulating food as drugs.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Referred to Subcommittee on Health and the Environment.

bill.summary: 1/21/1987--Introduced. Foods Are Not Drugs Act of 1987 - Amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to exclude from the definitions of "drug" and of "food additive" foods for special dietary use, i.e. vitamins and minerals, where such foods are promoted or offered for sale in the diagnosis, mitigation, treatment, or prevention of disease. Provides that food shall be considered misbranded if oral representations have been made with respect to the food which are false or misleading in any particular.
